Wow! Such wealth of info... This is really great... So I take it the 
Roshigumi was formed before the Shinsengumi and that some members of 
this group who stayed in Kyoto joined both the Shinsengumi and 
Mimawarigumi. Sugoi!

Hmmm... I wonder how modern Japan thinks of Sasaki? Either way, it's 
good to know that's how he is, all the better.

The story about the girl, hilarious! I'm wondering though if they 
ever saw through the disguise. I hope they didn't because, I don't 
know I'd think it'd be mean for them to do that and I always had this 
vision of them being galant. :O)

Thanks again for the info... Really appreciate it! Ja ne!

> Sasaki comes across to me as a guy who has some definite ideas of 
> exactly how he wants things done and when. Sort of the type to 
say "When 
> I say 'Jump!' you ask how high."
> 
> >By the way this may sound odd (you might be thinking I should know 
> >this but I don't), who is the Roshigumi? >>
> >
> They were the group of 200 or so samurai who joined up to go to 
Kyoto to 
> help the Shogunate quell the unrest/violence. The one 
backing/paying 
> them I believe was a Matsudaira can't-remember-just-now (not 
Katamori, 
> his father or grandfather)
> 
> Kiyokawa, the guy Sasaki is always pissed at just last week on the 
show 
> tried to slip past everyone in the rules and regulations that they 
are 
> not working for the Shogunate but "supporting the Emperor" 
i.e.siding 
> with the Choshu rebels. The bookish/smarmy Yamanami has caught this 
bit 
> of fine print and went to Sasaki with it and that's pretty much 
where it 
> left off. The synopsis for this week says:
> 
> <<Since Hachiro Kiyokawa's plan to make Roshigumi serve for the 
Imperial 
> Court, instead of the Shogunate is revealed, the leaders of 
Roshigumi, 
> including Tadasaburo Sasaki decides to take the members back to 
Edo. 
> ........ Keisuke Yamanami brings news that Roshigumi will be sent 
back 
> to Edo. Toshizo Hijikata suggests Isami to form another Roshigumi 
group 
> to stay in Kyoto. >>
> 
> You can read this synopses at the link below:
> http://www.nhk-jn.co.jp/wp/best_e.htm
> 
> There's a cool little side story where the daughter of the Yagi's 
(where 
> Kondou & Kamo's groups are staying has to disguise herself as a boy 
so 
> as not to draw attention from the miscreants invading their home. 
Kondou 
> & Hijikata come upon her and apparently make comments about her 
being 
> pretty puny to wield a sword. They mention the Tennen Rishin style 
and 
> I'm guessing they said "We'll teach it to you and make a man out of 
> you!" The poor girl runs crying to her mother the minute the guys 
walk 
> away. It was hilarious to see the girl's look of terror as they're 
> lifting her arms,squeezing her muscles, adjusting the sword she's 
> carrying in her belt.
>
